courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Orthopaedic Sports Medicine

meetings.instructor:
Miss LUI Ka Wai, 
Miss TANG Sheung Choi, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

Miss LUI Ka Wai, 
Miss TANG Sheung Choi, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

courses.description: This course is designed to give students a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of sports injuries – their causes, mechanisms, assessments and treatments with specific emphasis on recent advances in diagnosis and management skills.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the causes and mechanisms of common sports injuries; and consolidate essential injury prevention knowledge and skills.
courses.course_syllabus: Common risk factors associated with and that may influence sports injuries will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Sports Injury Prevention and Rehabilitation

meetings.instructor:
Miss LUI Ka Wai, 
Miss TANG Sheung Choi, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

courses.description: This course aims to develop a comprehensive and interdisciplinary approach to prevention, treatment and management of sports injuries. Clinical knowledge, practical skills for evidence-based practice in sports medicine are provided. Through a combination of formal classroom and clinical experience, injury prevention strategies and rehabilitation management are introduced in this course.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the factors and mechanisms that affect participation and tactics for preventing sports injuries.
courses.course_syllabus: The principles and goals of rehabilitation and return-to-play, and the rehabilitative exercise, corrective exercise, functional appraisal, clinical clearance and return-to-play protocol in a rehabilitation plan will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Applied Sports Science for Performance Enhancement
courses.description: This course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories and practical techniques applied to enhance sports performance. Exercise physiology, sports nutrition, sports psychology and some popular issues such as sports participation in extreme environments are covered.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify and apply the physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories for enhancing sports performance.
courses.course_syllabus: Factors determining sporting performance, methods to assess athletes’ abilities and ways to improve sports performance will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Medical Problems Encountered During Exercise and Sports Participation
courses.description: This course aims to demonstrate significant depth of knowledge of the medical aspects of sports medicine. It focuses on the identification and treatment of medical conditions of cardiovascular system, respiratory system, endocrine system, urinary and neurological system associated with physically active individuals and athletes.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the medical problems that occur during exercises; and deal with medical situations appropriately.
courses.course_syllabus: The basic principles and concepts of disease pathophysiology will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: The Multidisciplinary Approach in Sports Medicine
courses.description: This course aims to give students a comprehensive understanding of the applications of sports medicine from different disciplines in athletes, recreational sportsmen and the general population. It will focus on the multidisciplinary approach that allows sportsmen to recover from injuries and various health conditions.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to optimize overall health and wellness in athletes, recreational sportsmen and the general population; and evaluate and respond to injuries and various health conditions.
courses.course_syllabus: The importance of multidisciplinary approach in sports medicine will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Emergency Sports Medicine
courses.description: This course aims to provide comprehensive knowledge and practical skills in the assessment, treatment and management of emergent sports injuries. Emergent sports medicine management skills, emergency procedures, and advanced assessment skills, care and management of the specific injuries including head, spine, thoracic, and musculo-skeletal injuries are covered.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify, evaluate and handle any injuries or conditions that may occur during sports events.
courses.course_syllabus: Assessment, treatment and management of emergent and urgent sports injuries will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Sports Medicine Seminars & Clinical Trainings
courses.description: This course aims to widen the exposure of students and enable them to apply knowledge and skills they have learnt. It offers opportunities for students to attend various academic symposia throughout their study period and to have clinical attachment in the sports injury clinic.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn the latest development of sports medicine industry.
courses.course_syllabus: Updated information of sports medicine industry will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Team Doctor / Physiotherapist (I)

meetings.instructor:
Miss LUI Ka Wai, 
Miss TANG Sheung Choi, 
Professor YUNG Shu Hang Patrick

courses.description: This course is designed for doctors and physiotherapists. It aims to provide students with comprehensive team physician training. Students are able to learn and practice through workshops and on-field training in local and overseas mega sports events and sports competitions.The module runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one, and attend on-field training in semester two.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the role of team physician and team physiotherapist; and consolidates the assessment, treatment and rehabilitation skills of sports injuries.
courses.course_syllabus: Students will learn and practice the role of team physician and on-field medical management at pitch side.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students will complete the course evaluation form at the end of semester.
courses.required_readings: FIMS Team Physician Manual

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Team Doctor / Physiotherapist (II)
courses.description: Details please refer to ORTY5041 Team Dr / Physio (I).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: Details please refer to ORTY5041 Team Dr / Physio (I).
courses.course_syllabus: Students will learn the on-field medical management at pitch side through workshops and on-field training in mega sports events and local/overseas sports competitions.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Students will complete the course evaluation form at the end of semester.
courses.required_readings: FIMS Team Physician Manual

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Strength and Conditioning Coach (I)
courses.description: This course is co-organized by CUHK and Hong Kong Sports Institute. Students are able to practise the most advanced and scientific training for elite athletes for the best strength and conditioning. Students are able to make use of the knowledge gained to design a training plan and coach an athlete at the end of semester.This elective runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one (SCC I), and conduct a training programme in semester two (SCC II).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the role of strength and conditioning coach; and consolidates the assessment and training techniques.
courses.course_syllabus: Scientific knowledge and skills train the strength and conditioning of an athlete for better performance will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Strength and Conditioning Coach (II)
courses.description: Details please refer to ORTY5051 Strength and Conditioning Coach (I).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: Details please refer to ORTY5051 Strength and Conditioning Coach (I).
courses.course_syllabus: Details please refer to ORTY5051 Strength and Conditioning Coach (I).
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I)
courses.description: Students are required to conduct an independent research project / a systematic review or a meta-analysis on a specific topic related to sports medicine and health science. The module instructor and the project supervisors will guide the students to utilize the literature search engine to conduct a scientific systematical search, to quantitatively evaluate the quality of the paper to determine inclusion. If it is a research project, students will further formulate the research question, and then design the method and conduct sample size estimation. After collecting the data, students are required to perform statistical analysis, interpret the summarized data, and discuss the findings and values of the paper. Students have to present the topic and methodology in a research seminar in the first semester, and present the data and interpretation in the second semester.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn how to conduct a scientific research / systematic review or meta-analysis; and write up a publishable paper.
courses.course_syllabus: In-depth understanding of a topic related to sports medicine and health science should be demonstrated.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (II)
courses.description: Details please refer to ORTY5061 Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: Details please refer to ORTY5061 Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).
courses.course_syllabus: Details please refer to ORTY5061 Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Athletic Training (I)
courses.description: This course focuses on injury prevention, evaluation and acute care of sports injuries. Students will take up the role in bridging coaches, players and health care professionals in sports teams and will assist coaches in training. Students are able to learn through lectures, workshops and on-field training in various sports events.The elective runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one (AT I), and attend on-field training in semester two (AT II).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
courses.learning_outcomes: By the end of this course, students will be able to identify the role of Athletic Trainer; and consolidate the assessment, treatment and rehabilitation skills.
courses.course_syllabus: The prevention, acute care, and re-conditioning of sports injuries will be covered.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.subject: ORTY
courses.title: Athletic Training (II)
courses.description: Details please refer to ORTY5081 Athletic Training (I).
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Science
courses.learning_outcomes: Details please refer to ORTY5081 Athletic Training (I).
courses.course_syllabus: Details please refer to ORTY5081 Athletic Training (I).
courses.feedback_evaluation: Course and Teaching Evaluation is required after the last lesson.
courses.required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

courses.description: To conduct laboratory-based research work on the assigned research topic.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in PhD Orthopaedics and Traumatology
